attributes.action: Make it a fineable offence to leave litter on our beaches (and surrounds).
attributes.additional_details: We want patrollers issuing on-the-spot fines for people leaving their litter behind and bigger/better bin facilities for those wanting to clear their litter.
attributes.background: Hundreds of thousands of tourists flock to Bournemouth to enjoy the beautiful beaches. However most of those people don’t clear away their litter leaving the beaches in a horrendous state. Most gets washed into the sea, the rest has to be picked up by volunteers. We want on-the-spot fines!

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Littering on local beaches is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here: 

https://www.bournemouth.gov.uk/councildemocratic/GetInvolvedHaveyoursay/PetitionsDeputations.aspx
